result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmanuel T Hayes

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-25-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Emmanuel T Hayes.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea hearing.  Defense informs the court that Mr. Hayes has tested positive for COVID and requests an adjournment.  Court ordered COVID documentation to be provided at the next court date.  Parties inform the court of new charges.  Court scheduled a status conference and informs Mr. Hayes that an IN PERSON appearance is REQUIRED.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022, filed.  rmm
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 10-17-2022

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Emmanuel T Hayes.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. OReilly requests this matter be transferred to Br. 2 for resolution. Case is adjourned to Br. 2.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-16-2022, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Violation Report 08-05-2022, filed.  rmm

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear, appearance is waived. Hearing held via zoom. Parties are negotiating a global resolution. Court authroizes transfer to Branch 02 for resolution only, if accepted. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-25-2022, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-25-2022, filed.  rmm

Court ordered no contact with ANY Walmart
No Contact Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes not in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/4/22 @ 2:30p
